title: RFI reporter, 楊眉, report ‘pro-hk security law’ fake news

replies.msg:
The interviewee is against the national security law,
but the news reporting, written by rfi 楊眉, claimed the interviewee support the law.

法國國營電台rfi篡改訪問稿，老屈香港受訪者支持國安法
https://lih.kg/2031214
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區

’Hi, I am writing to express my deepest concern regarding one of your problematic journalists "Yang Mei" or "楊眉", her outrageous distortion of interview contents and blatant attempt to work as China's mouthpiece.

In Yang Mei’s problematic article, she purposely distorted the interviewees’ responses, dubbed it with subtitles that carry an opposite meaning and blatantly put words in the respondent’s mouth.

For example, the female respondent at 1:02 replies that:
“Hong Kong is a free country. It’s inappropriate to introduce China’s Security Law. Now we are an unfree and undemocratic country.”
Yang distorted the meaning and dubbed it as:
“Hong Kong is a free ‘region’ and violent activities should not go on. This isn’t freedom nor democracy.”
I found the professionalism and morality of journalist Yang highly dubious. She appears to me more like an endorser of China’s authoritarian regime who’s willing to create fake news any day of the week, instead of a neutral and fair journalist like she’s supposed to be. I’d like to express my strongest protest against this and will make sure to share this unfortunate news regarding RFI with all my friends.

On a side note, Traditional Chinese users do not use “” at all but use 「」instead. I’d like to ask RFI to look into this issue regarding Yang’s lack of morality and ability.

Thank you.‘

Copied from above post
